body: @yang-g  or @dgquintas , can you help? This is preventing us from seeing green test on internal_ci windows.
After talking offline, it seems @yang-g will likely have some insights.

I have no insight :)
Looking at the failure history and it does not seem to fail on jenkins. Also it fails in different test cases though all in a similar fashion: server gets the call but client times out. I am experimenting with the timeout up from 2s to 20in #11360. It seems we do not run pull requests tests in internal_ci for windows, is there a way to run one off test?

Yes, it is internal_ci specific.  I tried to increase the timeout here and it didn't help.
https://kokoro.corp.google.com/job/grpc/job/windows/job/experimental/job/jtattermusch_experiment/8/
Everything else is passing and this test is failing in 100% cases on kokoro and that makes me think it's something else than just a timeout.

There is a way to run a one off test on kokoro, but it's a bit cumbersome at this point.

```
I0531 23:34:05.625000000  3084 invalid_call_argument_test.c:185] test_send_initial_metadata_more_than_once
I0531 23:34:08.890000000  1128 dns_resolver.c:185] dns resolution failed (will retry): {"created":"@1496298848.890000000","description":"OS Error","file":"T:\src\github\grpc\workspace_c_windows_dbg_native\vsprojects\..\src\core\lib\iomgr\resolve_address_windows.c","file_line":106,"os_error":"No such host is known.\r\n","syscall":"getaddrinfo","wsa_error":11001}
D0531 23:34:08.890000000  1128 dns_resolver.c:191] retrying in 1.000000000 seconds
I0531 23:34:12.140000000  2280 dns_resolver.c:185] dns resolution failed (will retry): {"created":"@1496298852.140000000","description":"OS Error","file":"T:\src\github\grpc\workspace_c_windows_dbg_native\vsprojects\..\src\core\lib\iomgr\resolve_address_windows.c","file_line":106,"os_error":"No such host is known.\r\n","syscall":"getaddrinfo","wsa_error":11001}
D0531 23:34:12.140000000  2280 dns_resolver.c:191] retrying in 1.000000000 seconds
I0531 23:34:15.390000000   992 dns_resolver.c:185] dns resolution failed (will retry): {"created":"@1496298855.390000000","description":"OS Error","file":"T:\src\github\grpc\workspace_c_windows_dbg_native\vsprojects\..\src\core\lib\iomgr\resolve_address_windows.c","file_line":106,"os_error":"No such host is known.\r\n","syscall":"getaddrinfo","wsa_error":11001}
D0531 23:34:15.390000000   992 dns_resolver.c:191] retrying in 1.000000000 seconds
E0531 23:34:16.656000000  3084 cq_verifier.c:234] no event received, but expected:
tag(1) GRPC_OP_COMPLETE success=0 T:\src\github\grpc\workspace_c_windows_dbg_native\vsprojects\..\test\core\end2end\invalid_call_argument_test.c:199
```
when I increased the timeout, it looks like there's more "No such host is known" errors (wsa_error 11001). Not sure why the name would fail to resolve though.

It doesn't look like increasing the timeout is helping here.

Any other ideas? This is the last failing test on windows kokoro, so I'd like to get a fix ASAP.

I'd print the value of "host" and "port" being passed to `getaddrinfo` at
https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/src/core/lib/iomgr/resolve_address_windows.c#L95

On 2 June 2017 at 16:52, Jan Tattermusch <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> It doesn't look like increasing the timeout is helping here.
>
> Any other ideas? This is the last failing test on windows kokoro, so I'd
> like to get a fix ASAP.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/11284#issuecomment-305933717>, or mute
> the thread

> .
>

More findings:
if I only run test `test_recv_status_on_client_from_server`, it passes.

If I run these two tests, I get the usual failure (test_recv_status_on_client_from_server fails)
```
test_send_initial_metadata_more_than_once();
test_recv_status_on_client_from_server();
```

The error details is here:
```
I0609 17:15:28.889000000  3656 completion_queue.c:549] cq_end_op_for_next(exec_ctx=028DF8D8, cc=00332310, tag=00000001, error={"created":"@1497024928.889000000","description":"Failed to create subchannel","file":"T:\grpc\vsprojects\..\src\core\ext\filters\client_channel\client_channel.c","file_line":964,"referenced_errors":[{"created":"@1497024928.889000000","description":"Pick cancelled","file":"T:\grpc\vsprojects\..\src\core\ext\filters\client_channel\client_channel.c","file_line":1069,"referenced_errors":[{"created":"@1497024928.889000000","description":"Deadline Exceeded","file":"T:\grpc\vsprojects\..\src\core\ext\filters\deadline\deadline_filter.c","file_line":46,"grpc_status":4}]}]}, done=013BF6F0, done_arg=00332F2C, storage=00332F30)
I0609 17:15:28.889000000  2456 completion_queue.c:846] RETURN_EVENT[00332310]: OP_COMPLETE: tag:00000001 ERROR
```

Do you mean `test_send_initial_metadata_more_than_once()` is the only test that fails out of all the ones in that file? Also, that error seems unrelated: it's simply the cancellation of the subchannel creation upon timing out. Can you also include the full log? It's hard to see where the failure it's happening (first time we send the duplicated md? second?)

I meant that `test_send_initial_metadata_more_than_once`  does something that subsequently break `test_recv_status_on_client_from_server` (which passes on its own).

The full test log (only running the 2 tests):

What's odd about the log is that `gettaddrinfo: localhost  1148` is missing in the log (the client channel should attempt to resolve it to contact the server running at 0.0.0.0  1148)
